titles.title: A bill to authorize the adjustment of the boundaries of the South Dakota portion of the Sioux Ranger District of Custer National Forest, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S594)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of Agriculture, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 103-10.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 24.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 5, rule I, the chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed until March 30.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 417 - 3 (Roll No. 117).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 1/21/1993--Introduced. Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to accept title to any non-Federal lands within five miles of the exterior boundaries of the South Dakota portion of the Sioux Ranger District of Custer National Forest, which are found to be chiefly valuable for national forest purposes in exchange for national forest lands in Custer National Forest. Incorporates such lands into the forest.
